title: CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation)
content:
1. Call emergency number.
2. Push hard and fast in the center of the chest.
3. Give rescue breaths if trained.
4. Continue until help arrives.

title: Snake Bite Treatment
content:
1. Keep the patient calm and still.
2. Remove jewelry and tight clothing.
3. Position the bite below heart level.
4. Clean the wound with water.
5. Do NOT cut or suck the wound.

title: Dehydration & Heatstroke
content:
Signs: Dry mouth, dizziness, dark urine.
Action: Drink water in small sips. Move to a cool, shaded area. Loosen clothing. Cool the body with water.

title: Starting a Fire
content:
1. Gather tinder (dry grass, leaves), kindling (small twigs), and fuel (logs).
2. Create a tepee or log cabin structure.
3. Light the tinder from upwind.
4. Gradually add larger wood.

title: Water Purification
content:
1. Boiling: Boil water for at least 1 minute.
2. Chemical: Use iodine or chlorine tablets.
3. Filtration: Use a portable water filter or cloth layers for debris.

title: Identifying Edible Plants
content:
Dandelion: Entire plant is edible. Yellow flowers, jagged leaves. High in Vitamin A and C.
Pine Trees: Young needles steeped in hot water make a Vitamin-rich tea.
Cattails: The inner stalk is edible raw or cooked; looks like a corn dog.

title: Poisonous Plants to Avoid
content:
Poison Ivy: 'Leaves of three, let it be.' Can cause severe rashes.
Deadly Nightshade (Belladonna): Shiny black berries and bell flowers. Extremely toxic.
Water Hemlock: Purple-spotted stems and white umbrella flowers. Fatal if ingested.

title: The Bowline Knot
content:
Purpose: A secure, fixed loop that won't slip or bind.
1. Create a small loop (the hole).
2. Pass the end (rabbit) up through the hole.
3. Go around the standing line (tree).
4. Pass back down through the hole and pull tight.

title: The Clove Hitch
content:
Purpose: Securing a rope to a post or tree.
1. Wrap the rope around the post.
2. Cross the rope over itself and wrap again.
3. Tuck the end under the second wrap and pull tight.
